website_summaries.verdict: Practical for most home and auto applications, but not a pro-level tool. If you turn to the owners' manual for help, you may not find it there.
pros: Reads the 10 most needed functions and has a vivid LCD screen w/backlight
Can be used wirelessly or w/leads
cons: Sometimes takes several tries to get voltage readings
Issues with capacitance readings have been reported
User manual could be more detailed

customer_reviews.title: It is heavy and feels like a solid piece of equipment It's something of a ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked at the several multimeters Amazon displayed and picked this. It is heavy and feels like a solid piece of equipment It's something of a fiddle getting the included batterty in placeAs a bonus it has a keyhole cutout in back and a fold out stand. The leads aren't impressive but heavy duty looking, I will replace the alligator clips with mini grabbers It will replace two el chepo meters So far accuracy has been fine for my hobbyist needs. My only caveat is plan on replacing the leads
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Chobanian

customer_reviews.title: ... remains illuminated for 10 seconds which makes it almost useless for my use
customer_reviews.text: I really needed a backlit display but this one only remains illuminated for 10 seconds which makes it almost useless for my use. No instructions came with it but common sense allows easy operation, If you want a simple DMM, this one very well could serve your purpose unless the backlit display is desired. I will not return it as it functions but will need to replace it very soon as I need a backlit display. 3 stars due to the display and lack of a users manual but aside from that it would be 5 stars. If anyone knows of a website for instructions, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: John Reid

customer_reviews.title: Works great, alligator clips fall off easy
customer_reviews.text: I like this multimeter. It has a rugged feel and has worked well for checking the car battery with the min setting. The one thing I wished worked better was the alligator clips. They come off a little too easy, and often when just picking up the device with the probes in the holders on the back. The concept is great, just needs a tweak in this department so the alligator clips have a more solid contact.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby
customer_reviews.text: MECP Certified Tech with Geek Squad: It has been a great buy as far as testing goes. Good enough to get the average Joe through anything they could ever need. I would like a bit faster response time on the AC voltage variation to see audio signal pulsing without question but gets the job done for sure. 10a fuse is fairly easy to find and replace if needed and I can say first hand (a few times now) the fuse will blow before the unit. Leads could be longer but work well and battery last for quite a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: Why is it so hard to get someone to write a manual in a specific language?
customer_reviews.text: I guess the multimeter is okay, no perfect, but for the price, okay. My biggest complaint is with the manual - obviously written by someone who doesn't have english language skills. I consider that a big failing when dealing with a technical item, especially one that could be destroyed by faulty use. For instance, the manual states "before test there exits", "The test pen to reliably touch the test point", " there will damage the instrument circuit", "three seconds to be light on and off" - - just a sample of dozens of errors that make the manual almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ron White

customer_reviews.title: Defective and Dangerous!!!
customer_reviews.text: The multimeter did not beep when in continuity mode as soon as I received it. The Beeper works though because it beats when changing selections. After I setup a return I noticed that I would show 0.00v when measuring a ac circuit!!! Death Trap!!! Before contacting amazon to return item I tried to contact seller and still haven't got a response 2 weeks later. Originally when I first received the meter I was very impressed by the appearance of it. But other then that I'm not impressed. Maybe I received a defective meter but the seller never contacted me.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE AURA

customer_reviews.title: Unhelpful  ungrammatical manual.  Good price.  Alligator clips were useless
customer_reviews.text: Subtract 1 star for useless manual written in a dialect of English that would not get past a basic grammer checker. Do not buy if you have any questions or qualms about using the tool that you might want cleared up by the manual. The manual has a QR code that refers you to a video that might have helpful stuff in it. However, as of 12/2018 the link did not work. Subtract 1 star for poor quality alligator clips. The straight leads worked fine for me. Good price. Good features. But the lack of quality of the manual makes we worry about a lack of quality inside the device.
customer_reviews.author: John from Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be accurate, measures quickly and is well made. Displays is large and easy to read. Internally it has large fuses for current measurements - proper fuses for rated voltage. Many others meters use small cheap glass fuses rated only for 250V. Even more amazing is, that for less $20 total you also get two sets of quality probes with soft insulation - most likely silicon rubber. It used to be premium (when I was younger) and inexpensive meters were supplied only with cheap stiff PVC insulation wires.
customer_reviews.author: Jerzy Z Potopowicz

customer_reviews.title: Best multimeter for its price
customer_reviews.text: I was really just wanting a cheap multimeter to do some basic mechanical work at home. I wasn’t expecting much when I ordered this. To my surprise, it’s a lot better than what I would have ever thought for the price. It doesn’t look or feel cheap and has a lot of measuring modes and capabilities. It even comes some pretty decent test leads and attachments. Is it a professional series multimeter? No. It will however, do basically anything around the house or personal garage. It’s probably the best for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-meter
customer_reviews.text: Great Multi-meter at a great price, comes with nice accessories but I took away one star because of the light once on, it turns off after 10 seconds which is long enough my previous one would stay on then turn off auto. 10 or 15 just isn't long enough if you're working in a dark area, but in the light, the numbers are large enough to be seen. And you have an auto function so no much trying to fig it out just let the meter do it for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dmusic

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Used it the first time worked good, a month after I tried to use it and got unstable & unaccurate readings, wouldnt stop beeping also. Changed battery and checked fuses, still nothing. Looks elsewhere for multimeters.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Godoy

customer_reviews.title: solid, great display
customer_reviews.text: I've had plenty of meters over the years so I am familiar with them. This is a nice meter with lots of features and attractively priced. I was especially impressed with the large display with good contrast which makes for easy readings. I took off the removable orange rubber case so it is less bulky. If you are prone to dropping things you might leave it on. The manual is a typical Chinese translation written in Engrish. It is difficult to read. But using these meters is pretty straight forward so you shouldn't need the manual anyway. It seemss well built and has a quality feel. It was a little larger than I expected but it's just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to measure body voltage in use with grounding/Earthing. We had a manual range multi meter, but couldn't figure out how to use it to measure body voltage, so we went with this inexpensive auto ranging unit. It feels very sturdy and high quality. It works great measuring how much voltage we are exposed to in different areas of our house. And it demonstrates how grounding the body lowers that voltage dramatically. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great Inexpensive Multimeter!!
customer_reviews.text: Super nice piece of test equipment for 19.99!. "These are sleepers". I read that in another review and bought one. I They are well made easy to use and accurate. They ship with extra leads and Alligator clips. The box even works as a case! These are much better then a typical multimeter on par with testers that cost ALOT more. I believe with proper care and use it will last me for a lifetime!
customer_reviews.author: E Black

customer_reviews.title: A nice looking Fluke clone
customer_reviews.text: Dont know how good it is at this point. I work in a snack processing plant so i will put it to the test today . More to come... UPDATE: True RMS readings are about 30 volts less than a Fluke meter. Voltage and resistance readings matched the Fluke meter. So if you want a cheap meter for basic voltage and resistance readings then no problem. But for anything else get a Fluke
customer_reviews.author: waltergreene

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to meters that cost hundreds more
customer_reviews.text: Long term review, owned about a year. I’m an automotive technician and was looking for something to have at home but didn’t wanna spend the price I do for the flukes I have at work. I frequently use meters and oscilloscopes, there is nothing bad to say about this one! It is auto-ranging, accurate, and easy to use. Been looking for a third meter to add to my arsenal at work and ended up taking it in! For the money there is no comparison!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Good household and DIYer meter.
customer_reviews.text: The Thsinde 18B digital multimeter is a good performer for its low price. I prefer my better set of test leads to the included ones. Although the descriptions indicate that it's built with two internal fuses, the manual provides no info on how to access them. So apparently one would split open the snap-together case where its top and bottom seams meet, hopefully without tearing them up, since there aren't pry slots or screws. If I find out, I'll revise my review.
customer_reviews.author: R. Widebrook

customer_reviews.title: Great meter for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a fluke 87 at work and quite honestly this meter is just as good as my fluke. The only down side are the test leads are the basic leads and not the silicone test leads, which I think are super nice but not a big deal not having them. The benefit of having the backlight on the screen is very handy but on this meter the light shuts off after a few seconds where as on my fluke it stays on until I shut it off. Over all I am happy I bought this meter for home and would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great multimeter if you use the golden leads
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with the flakiness of the multimeter using the standard thick leads until I started using the included gold plated very sharp test leads. The gold plating makes a big difference and I was able to get a quick and stable response in the auto ranging resistance and continuity tests. With the standard thick leads, the continuity test didn't work well and resistance would fluctuate up and down.
customer_reviews.author: hl

customer_reviews.title: True rms for this price Wow
customer_reviews.text: Have not checked all functionality yet but from what I see you can't beat the price, I have had fluke meters as a field tech for many years and find this very comparable, would be a great back up meter and if it grew legs you would not cry about it, doubt it would pass the drop test as well as a fluke.good meter for the money
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fix for loose alligator clips
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent meter and the seller offers outstanding support. Several reviewers have mentioned that the alligator clips fall off too easily. My solution for this is to remove the clip from its protective cover and use a crimping tool to tighten it. With a little adjustment they work fine. Also, make sure you press the probe leads fully into the meter as they can be stiff to fully insert at first. The meter itself and responsive support exceeded my expectations for such a low cost unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alligator clips are very cheap
customer_reviews.text: The clip the vendor provided are actually designed for soldering to a wire, not frequently be slid in and out as normal use would entail. Fortunately for me, I was unable to even slide the terminal piece into the alligator clip, so it raised a red flag with me. The rest of the meter seems nicely made, though a bit complicated compared to my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Seymour Gomez

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I like this multimeter, it's accurate and the price is extremely appealing, my only fault with this product is the backlight, it's only on for 15 seconds and turns off, try to measure something in 15 seconds before it turns off. aside from that, I love it. ability to keep the backlight on would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: A deal at twice the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great meter at twice the price. Nice large, backlit display, the dial feels solid, the non contact voltage detection is a nice addition too. Once you've used a meter with min/max recording, you get really spoiled. I bought it to have something to use around the house and working on cars. It'll be great for that. It's also pretty much right on par with voltage readings on my Agilent at work. I'm very happy with this meter, especially considering what it cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Gant

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive Multi-Meter
customer_reviews.text: Though there may be a small variation from my fluke, I keep it on the boat and don't worry if it is destroyed like I would my fluke. I get good readings to quickly troubleshoot problems with everything from the genset, alternators, to electronics and galvanic checks and never worry about dropping it in the bilge or other calamity that normally happens on a boat.
customer_reviews.author: JoeMerchant

customer_reviews.title: Good multimeter
customer_reviews.text: Served me through my entire digital electronics class. Most of the provided multimeters had blown fuses and some just showed garbage data, which was annoying. This multimeter essentially became the multimeter of the entire class, and to this date I haven't had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: NerdBird

customer_reviews.title: Auto Ranging Digital Multimeter TRMS 6000
customer_reviews.text: Meter is very accurate when calibrated against some highend units. A surprise for a meter in this price range. For our everyday work, it won't break your heart and your wallet if you accidentally damaged it. This unit is very adequate for everyday use and I don't see why one needs to spend hundreds of dollar on name brand.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Sportsman

customer_reviews.title: Good, useful product
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why some people are unhappy with this multimeter. I just got mine today. The unit is large, feels so in your palm, has large, easy to read display and my capacitor testing showed proper reading. Comes with two sets of prongs and one set of alligator clips! And a 9 v battery. I have three other meters but none had capacitor reading. Our A/C stopped working so I needed one to check the capacitor. This is not a Fluke that costs ten times more but useful for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Bala Chandran

customer_reviews.title: Ohm meter does not work
customer_reviews.text: When I Bought it in January 2020, I used it mostly for voltage measurement. Now, in July 2020, I needed to use the Ohmmeter and found out it does not work.. With only 6 months warranty, I missed the window by a few days, so I'm stuck with defective meter. hope they can still fix it, stay tuned...
customer_reviews.author: Avi Z

customer_reviews.title: Amazing DMM for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing meter for the price! I made direct comparison measurements to my $400 Keysight U1273A and they agreed within a less than 1%. This was on AC/DC volts, 60Hz and resistance. I'm an electrical engineer and us lots of meters.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: No Instruction Manual
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculous to sell a piece of gear with all the capabilities of this thing with NO INSTRUCTION MANUAL. You get a little sheet of paper with some pidgin English TINY print that gives a few range charts. No instructions. Completely worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke Beagle

customer_reviews.title: No complaints about the performance but it’s just XXXL size
customer_reviews.text: They say first That the calculator could fit inside a whole room. This multimeter kind of Gives me a similar feeling. The only reason I had to return it was because it is ginormous size. Why would anyone want to make a simple multimeter SOOO BIG???
customer_reviews.author: BASHAH.LLC

customer_reviews.title: I’m very happy with this multimeter
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with this multimeter. I’m an ASE and Nissan master certified technician and for every day use I have an over priced but phenomenal fluke. I purchased this to use when I’m working on side jobs at home. It is accurate and reminds me a lot of the flukes. I highly recommend, I highly doubt you can find a better multimeter for the money. I’m shocked this little guy is priced at such a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lewis Doane jr

customer_reviews.title: This is a great Multi-Meter!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Multi-Meter! One issue was the test leads. I was getting erroneous readings due to bad internal connections in the test leads. When I replaced them with banana plug/alligator clip leads, all readings were perfect. Test the included leads one at a time. Each one should read less that one ohm resistance. If not, replace the leads. The meter works very well on all settings. You'll enjoy the "high voltage proximity sensor".
customer_reviews.author: Skyking

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: for a knock off it does the job, price features are ok, I had a name brand one I sold and could only afford this one, but I only use these a few times a year. I did replace the leads with klein brand leads from big tool store. so you get what you pay for, I would buy the name brands if I could afford it next time.
customer_reviews.author: MrD

customer_reviews.title: exelent
customer_reviews.text: Five stars because it works, gives accurate readings, comes with a battery, and has included alligator clips. Have already used if to troubleshoot some issues I was having with my solar power system. The alligator clips are great if you need to use your hands to do other things than hold the probes in place while perfoming tests. Can't beat the price either. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: m v

customer_reviews.title: Good Meter
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the quality for a cheap meter. The alligator clips are pretty bad, though. I haven't tested the frequency meter section yet. I'm a bit excited about that. This is my second review. I liked the first one so much that I bought a second to use in the barn. The alligator clips are still crap. Buy a set of clip leads and use those. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unit OK...Alligator clips the opposite of OK.
customer_reviews.text: The unit is bulky...but it probably works fine. But the reason we got this one was the alligator clips...need those. The reason we sent it back was the alligator clips...unusable . Not sure why they would package a fairly decent low-cost unit with alligator clips that function about as well as hair pins. C'mon guys.
customer_reviews.author: vanmaarth

customer_reviews.title: Great multimeter - amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this multimeter because I had an older simpler one which lacked certain features this provided. I was amazed to find the TRMS 6000 for the same price I paid for my crappy multimeter and was scared it was too good to be true but besides the quality of the clamps (which is low like many wrote but still usable) the multimeter is top notch and definitely an amazing value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tal M.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty fancy, compared to my cheap manual Walmart one! Sturdy and seems accurate and reliable so far. Really like the fine tip leads and alligator clips included. Just don’t buy the case amazon recommends to go with this model! You can’t fit anything but the unit and one set of leads in there, as long as you unplug them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin U.

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: price is good, easy to use. Bought this for a partner in work. So far he is comfortable with it and it does what it needs for him. gives accurate readings and will aid in basic testing of household or even some medium appliances etc
customer_reviews.author: El Capitan

customer_reviews.title: Included alligator clips! Great idea!
customer_reviews.text: Five stars because it works, gives accurate readings, comes with a battery, and has included alligator clips. Have already used if to troubleshoot some issues I was having with my solar power system. The alligator clips are great if you need to use your hands to do other things than hold the probes in place while perfoming tests. Can't beat the price either. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and use. I do not have reference equipment to measure accuracy, so I assume it is good enough (have not seen any reason to doubt it). The flip out stand in the back is a hand saver. My goto multimeter.
customer_reviews.author: Moke

customer_reviews.title: Great multimeter, but could use some improvements.
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars! I would not talk about the features, as other people already mentioned that. From personal use, I like it, however there are two things that are annoying. 1. The LED turns of rather quickly, this is annoying if you are in. a dark place, and are multitasking while reading the numbers. 2. The unit has 2 loud beeps. This is on par with a smoke alarm in my opinion. Besides that, I have not had any other issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mergon

customer_reviews.title: Good DMM for the price.
customer_reviews.text: You can get a more accurate auto ranging meter for the about the same price with a different look and feel. This meter is about on par with an auto ranging ExTech 430, but at about 1/4 the price, and with more features. It seems to be a good general purpose/bench DMM.
customer_reviews.author: Eng I. Neer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this is a very decent product and it arrived just in time when I was about to fix the wiring issue in my bathroom. Some people might not enjoy the beep because it might be loud for someone. However, I think it just shows how sensitive this meter is. I definitely like a more pleasant sound. However, it just shows how sensitive this meter is. Sensitivity is very important for this kind of products. I have not finished tested the product yet. But for now, I would give a five for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Wang

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Nice for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Had this meter a few days now, seems to work well. Got it to replace an old Radio Shack digital multi-meter that got dropped one time to many. Only problem with this one is the test leads, they only work intermittently. Not a problem for me, I had planned on using the much nicer silicone leads i had gotten several years ado for my old meter. I would buy again as I suspect the lead problem is a aberration.
customer_reviews.author: Pbilling

customer_reviews.title: Good value.  Would recommend.  Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good value for the price. I would recommend this tester. While I had a problem with my original order (the test leads were defective), the seller was very accommodating and immediately sent out replacements which worked fine. Very good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ohms not the most accurate
customer_reviews.text: Ran into some issues with the Ohm function. Probes have ~.3 ohms resistance. Read some of my high quality transistors wrong. Would recommend on a budget. Also for whatever the hell reason, the "light" function illuminates the screen for 10 seconds, max. Who wants 10 seconds of light? Who? Not me thats who! Don't buy if you want the light function alone.
customer_reviews.author: pp

customer_reviews.title: Great Meter, good value, but
customer_reviews.text: The alligator clip attachments are cheaply made, small and fiddly to use. The insulation makes it difficult to open the clips easily. I have one clip that sticks open. Overall the meter appears very well made, but the clips need improvement
customer_reviews.author: WrenchUK

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, nearly as good as others that cost three times as much. The leads are a little on the poor quality and the materials for the case and protective cover could be better but not dinging them too much on this because you can only get so much at this price point. Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sharpsteel

customer_reviews.title: Big readout when looking straight on.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of meter for the money. Easy to read when looking straight on. Off angle has low contrast. Audible tone is easy to hear. Time will tell if rotary switch is durable.
customer_reviews.author: FreeMike1001

customer_reviews.title: Loose probes ! Mad
customer_reviews.text: Okay as soon as I used it I was made ! I’m a mechanic at a dealership and I purchased this one to use at the house but the leads you have to move them back and forth to get them to pick up ! I should have sent it back . The probes aren’t getting a good connection to the meter .
customer_reviews.author: julie jenkins

customer_reviews.title: really nice multi-meter device
customer_reviews.text: really nice multi-meter device. It even has NCV included which I really love since it does come in very handy for me. quality is good and the size is big so easy to read. looks very durable and can withstand drops. I've included a video of the NCV which I really like.
customer_reviews.author: Barry L

customer_reviews.title: Get better leads
customer_reviews.text: Very functional fluke clone. It’s no fluke but it does work ok. Functional enough for most folks. But the leads it comes with are not great. Get new leads.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Nice meter for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it a few days but it seems like a nice MM. The leads seem sturdy and don’t feel cheap. The polarity for installing the battery wasn’t marked but it showed it in the instructions. I’m not a heavy user of meters so I can’t say how it would do on a job site but for around the house it seems like a good buy so far.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Nope.  No good for capacitance checking.
customer_reviews.text: I seemed to work for A/C voltage. Auto Range and manual range for capacitance do not work. It shows nano Farad no matter what size capacitor I tested. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Does the job nicely for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Autoranging works well. Easy to use. Great price. Well built and sturdy. For me, the most important feature is the automatic shut off when not in use. Previous meters I had did not have this feature and all it took was forgetting to turn it off one time and the battery would be dead the next time I had to use it. I have had this meter for a year and have not had to replace the battery.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice While it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Here I am almost 9 months later. The device had occasional use, I went to use it and the battery was dead, I changed out the battery and was greeted by a smell of electronic smoke. I probably wont be buying one again.
customer_reviews.author: John DeVita

customer_reviews.title: Seems built well except the alligator clips seem worthless. ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems built well except the alligator clips seem worthless. And the instruction book is also worthless, but used it on my car battery which just happened to die right after I received this and it showed that it was trash, but also showed my alternator was working!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: You get what yo pay for
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 6 months when new battery was changed.
customer_reviews.author: Fishing Jeep

customer_reviews.title: Decent DMM
customer_reviews.text: Brought this cheapie to keep at home. Very slow meter, leads it came with, well I don't know where I threw them. Good enough for most people but professional auto/electrical, no way.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, this IS NOT a Fluke meter.  That’s for sure!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, this IS NOT a Fluke meter. That’s for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: The multimeter was arrived on time and in good condition. It feels pretty hevry too
customer_reviews.text: The multimeter was arrived on time and in good condition. It feels pretty hevry too; not like one of those cheap ones you can get at Harbor Freight! The fact that this multimeter has a built in backlight is was sold me. Having to shine direct light on your meter just to read the screen can be a pain. It arrived on time and in good condition. My husband liked it very much. it works just like he want it to and seems like really good quality.
customer_reviews.author: tracy

customer_reviews.title: This multimeter seems sturdy and well made and I would definitely recommend it ...
customer_reviews.text: This just arrived yesterday. I've worked with it a bit and am new to using multimeters. I downloaded the user manual and followed some of the instructions. I got onto YOuTube and checked out some of their videos. Not sure, but for my purposes, I probably should have purchased one with fewer bells and whistles. This multimeter seems sturdy and well made and I would definitely recommend it to anyone. The seller was prompt and it was well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Poncie

customer_reviews.title: Great features for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is not a fluke, but it does not carry a fluke pricing. For what it can do and the price, it is just a solid product. This I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mickeysoft

customer_reviews.title: not as easy to use for beginners
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner, I was looking for an easy to use multi meter. This one is not as easy as it is made out to be. I will be looking for something more simple
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: The alligator clips that supposed to attach to the leds are useless they don’t stay on also the color is more of a peach in the pics it looks orange, the unit is a little clunky and big, I was looking for something more compact, Debating whether to send it back..
customer_reviews.author: L. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work for what it is, but it's obviously cheap with several problems. One of the test leads had the tip broken off. The pictured alligator clips weren't included. There's nothing in the battery compartment indicating which way it goes. The manual is a bad translation. I'll use it until it breaks and then buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: JJS

customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for, great value for price!
customer_reviews.author: Terin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: The product worked fine when i got it. Its only been 3 months and i have only used it a couple of times. Now it is not working at all. Batteries are fine and the fuses are intacted, it just won't work. Doesn't even turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R Schlotman

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got about 9 months use of it before readings went haywire. Tried new leads but that's not problem.
customer_reviews.author: Yo

customer_reviews.title: Dvm does it all
customer_reviews.text: Testing Batteries mostly, the non contact sensor was handy. Big display, good probes.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: this meter is just as good. Sure it lacks some if the extra luxuries ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the privilege to use, very very expensive meters and top name meters. But realistically speaking , this meter is just as good. Sure it lacks some if the extra luxuries the top brand has. I would choose this over a fluke any day
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic tester
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to test batteries. I tested it with AAA batteries and 9 volt and it works as expected. I also tested an outlet and it worked correctly. The instructions that come with this do not describe how to use this unit. It got the 4 stars because the instructions are so poor.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad price and Excellent for my applications
customer_reviews.text: I spent a little more money to buy this one instead of the 10 dollars cheap ones out there and I think I should have done that before.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great for commercial use
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this multimeter, it is rugged and well made. Measures voltage and ohms. Large numbers, easy to read. Works well I am using it in a commercial automotive shop setting and it is holding up great. Uses a 9v battery to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Very useful multimeter. I like to put it on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very useful multimeter. I like to put it on the table fixed, so that you can use at any time. The most important thing is the reading is accurate, some products have too much deviation will affect the test results. Products not only contain parts, but also very user-friendly to provide the battery, all businesses should do this.
customer_reviews.author: Hongyu Niu

customer_reviews.title: solid cheap meter
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little meter. Bought it for a spare. Seems to be just as accurate as my fluke. Only complaint it didn't come with the pictured 9v battery or alligator clips and back light only stays on for 10 sec top. But for the price...
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok but doesn’t zero well making readings not as accurate but I didn’t pay 125$ either
customer_reviews.author: David Baily

customer_reviews.title: USEFUL  MULTIMETER FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: LIKE THIS METER, WORKS WELL AND IS ACCURATE. FOR THIS PRICE THIS METER IS PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: rayray

customer_reviews.title: Loved this thing until it started giving insane voltages
customer_reviews.text: Loved this thing until it started giving insane voltages. A 5v signal now reads as 335 volts, a 12v signal as 86. Verified with another multimeter. Very frustrating, I had high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bollero

customer_reviews.title: Good meter for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read. Easy to use. Could have included a case. But I found a Klein case that works great with it. The additional leads are convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Davis

customer_reviews.title: Meter seems to work correctly, but probe wires are bad
customer_reviews.text: The meter seems to do all the functions advertised, but the probe wires are faulty, intermittent and do not connect well. They need to rework the probes for a better review.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Neis

customer_reviews.title: Useful, low cost, digital multimeter
customer_reviews.text: As a bonus this digital multimeter has the ability to provide measurement of capacitance along with the usual AC/DC voltage and current. Battery included as a bonus. Performs as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: cjrunner

customer_reviews.title: Works great, accurate, and tests capacitance
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. Bought it to test capacitance, but works great on all other functions as well. Just as accurate as my $60 meter.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Reliable and some the same features as my fluke.
customer_reviews.text: I install and service life safty systems and a reliable multi meter is your most used tool and it has to work properly. I have a $300 fluke but it needs to be calibrated, I would recommend this meter, I couldn't get my fluke calibrated for what this meter cost me.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed, Had to figure out how to use it...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, works as designed once you figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: A. McGeachy

customer_reviews.title: ... bit larger then I'm use to but it works great and is well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This meter is a bit larger then I'm use to but it works great and is well worth the money. It does have the voltage detection selection, "idiot light" that I like, which alerts me to possible issues that I can then respond to with the actual meter.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Foster

customer_reviews.title: Lot of Function for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I received this meter and got it out right away to try it out. I found that it has a lot of functionality for the money spent. it also seems to have better quality in the case and the design overall than my last meter that cost twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Cashin

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine just after I received in July went to use again in Oct and the amp settings would not work at all. Maybe this was a fluke but not happy with this model/brand.
customer_reviews.author: MrHemi

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice only complaint is the instructions could have been better.
customer_reviews.author: timothy holloway jr

customer_reviews.title: Great meter for the buck - I'm impressed
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of more expensive multimeters....pre-China made.....this one seems (so far) as good as the $150-$200 ones that I own. Easy to use, read, has backlight, and all the functionality that I need.
customer_reviews.author: PCS

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband and it has a variety of uses! Mainly we needed it to test fuses for his car. We easily determined which fuse was blown using this multimeter even though the damage wasn't visible to the naked eye. Would absolutely recommend to anyone looking!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily J.

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT BUY BUT LACKS A STORAGE CASE.
customer_reviews.text: WORKS FINE. WELL MADE. A FAIR PRICE BUT I WOULD NOT MIND HAVING PAID A LITTLE MORE FOR A CASE TO KEEP IT IN. HAVING A LOT OF MYSTERY POWERED BATTERIES, I USE IT FREQUENTLY. I HAVE BEEN STORING IT IN THE CARD BOARD SHIPPING BOX.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Auto Ranging MultiMeter
customer_reviews.text: Use tutorial from You Tube to learn various functions and how to use. Great multimeter for the price.
customer_reviews.author: George K Louie

customer_reviews.title: good meter
customer_reviews.text: i looked for a while before i found this one. simple to use,i love it
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: cheap knockoff of a Fluke meter. Intermittent solder joint on input jack to fuse.
customer_reviews.author: curious

customer_reviews.title: Good device, self ranging, big display.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, good enought for household use and comes with enough extras too. Its large, but that makes it easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: A. Junco

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it has alligator clips.. very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

product_meta.title: Auto Ranging Digital Multimeter TRMS 6000 with Battery Alligator Clips Test Leads AC/DC Voltage/Account,Voltage Alert, Amp/Ohm/Volt Multi Tester/Diode
feature_bullets: Continuity Test and Voltage Alert: Use the PTC ceramics protection circuit for Resistance and frequency measurement and Shielding Interference and Diode and Continuity Test can be 20000 µF
Non Contact Voltage Alert: When the detection of voltage is greater than 700V(RMS), keep close to the conductor, the instrument sensor will light and buzz.
With 10 Auto-Ranging: Accurately measures AC/DC voltage and current, frequency, resistance, diode and continuity NCV test, It's a good 10 Function Digital Multimeter
Easy Use and Clear Read: with large Overview Backlit LCD display which is visible in low light,3 times readings per second,3 5/6 Digital LCD Backlight Display for visibility in dimly lit areas
Package Content: Digital Multi Meter 9V Battery, English User's Manual, 2 x Test Leads, 2 Alligator Clips

specifications.Special Features: ✓6000 Counts True RMS Digital Multimeter ✓Auto Ranging ✓AC/DC Voltage ✓AC/DC Current ✓Resistance ✓Diode ✓Continuity ✓Frequency ✓Transistors ✓hFE ✓Overload Protection ✓Data Hold ✓Backlight Display ✓Low Battery Indication
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars516 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
